chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridget B. Dahms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF15 and 15CF228 @ 9:19 a.m. Revocation summaries received by parties. No additions or corrections. State gives sentencing arguments and recommendations, time served in each. Response by Atty Schuster, advises 119 days credit in 15CF228 and 112 days credit in 16CF15, asks for time served. Brief statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. 15CF228 - 5 months jail, credit for 119 days served. 16CF15 - 5 months jail, credit for 112 days served. Concurrent. Court believes sentences are complete. Nothing owed to convert to civil judgment. Postconviction rights.
Revocation Packet Summary
Sentencing hearing on revocation on August 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.
DNA Proof of Submission
DNA Order and Acknowledgement

Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco appearing for atty Jessica Schuster.  Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF228 and 16CF15 @ 9:23 a.m. Agreement stated - 15CF228 State moves to amend to misd. take and drive w/out consent but returning undamaged - 943.23(3m), withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as deemed appropriate, cc. 16CF15 State moves to amend to misd bail jumping 946.49(1)(a)  - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling, cc, credit for time served if revoked - since Jan 26, 2016 - 18 days credit if revoked. 15CF228 - 25 days credit if revoked. Atty Nocco and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed.  Court grants motion to amend 15CF228 to 943.23(3m). No contest plea. Court grants to amend 16CF15 to misd bail jumping. No contest plea. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties. Atty Nocco satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CF228 misd take and w/out consent and 16CF15 misd bail jumping. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. State feels not in best interest to forfeit bond and requests bond forf. hrg be canceled and bond not forfeited, gives reasons. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court will follow agreement. 15CF228 withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and counseling as deemed appropriate, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Credit for 25 days if revoked. 16CF15 withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA, counseling, court costs, DNA surcharge. Credit for 18 days if revoked. Bond to be applied to costs, return any balance to poster. Court finds not in interest of justice to forfeit bond. Postconviction rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Forfeiture Hearing

Bail/Bond - See 16-CF-15

Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court, in custody & via-video with attorney Jessica L Schuster, by telephone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls  @ 10:20 am.    Atty Schuster has copy of complaint, waives reading & def has been advised of charges and penalties. State will file motion to forfeit bond in 15CF228 and gives bond recommendation. Atty Schuster def will stay with relatives & can't post cash bond.  Court will order $2000.00 cash bond.  If family is in touch with Atty Schuster will review bond.  Atty Schuster waives time limits of p.h.  Bond to cover both files. State is moving to forfeit bond.  Court will forfeit bond in 15CF228 pending hearing. Court vacates warrant.  Status conference scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court vai video with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Special appearance by Atty Schuster.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Bond arguments by Atty Schuster.   Response by Atty Uttke for bond.  Additional arguments by Atty Schuster. Defendant Bridget B. Dahms in court via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 1:19 p.m. Def has copy of complaint. Charges, possible penalties, and atty rights reviewed. State heard on bond, asks for $5,000.00 cash bond. Response by Defendant. Court sets bond w/condition. Def asks to transfer to Marathon Co. Jail, gives reason. Court denies.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm. (verified with Judge, warrant is vacated)
